pr_title: HOTFIX: Fix broker bounce system tests

timeline.message: HOTFIX: Fix broker bounce system tests

timeline.bodyText: Is it enough to specify the processing guarantee as at_least_once here or do you want also for this test to include all processing guarantees in the test matrix?
timeline.author: cadonna
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -164,7 +164,7 @@ def setup_system(self, start_processor=True, num_threads=3):
 
         # Start test harness
         self.driver = StreamsSmokeTestDriverService(self.test_context, self.kafka)
-        self.processor1 = StreamsSmokeTestJobRunnerService(self.test_context, self.kafka, num_threads)
+        self.processor1 = StreamsSmokeTestJobRunnerService(self.test_context, self.kafka, "at_least_once", num_threads)

replies.bodyText: On a different note, now that the processing guarantee can be passed to the service, do we still need StreamsEosTestJobRunnerService and StreamsComplexEosTestJobRunnerService?
replies.author: cadonna

replies.bodyText: I feel neutral about it, if we are adding 2X time to system tests, that's probably not good.
replies.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText:
We can try to add both eos cases, too.
For Streams[Complex]EosTestJobRunnerService, they use a different Java class compared to the "smoke test" runner. Not sure if we could unify them?
replies.author: mjsax
